title: Rolling - cylinder rolls while slipping up a ramp

content.question: A hollow cylinder is initially sliding without rotating up a smooth section of a ramp that makes an angle <math alttext="theta sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math> with the horizontal, as shown in the figure. The cylinder then reaches a rough section of the ramp where the coefficient of kinetic friction between the cylinder and the ramp is <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></math>. The cylinder, which has mass <math alttext="m sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, radius <math alttext="r sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>, and rotational inertia about its center of <math alttext="I sub C equals m sub C, end sub, r sub C, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, starts to rotate while slipping on the rough section of the ramp. When the cylinder is rolling upward while slipping on the rough section, what is the magnitude <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> of the cylinder’s translational acceleration in terms of the magnitude <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi></math> of its angular acceleration and the given quantities?
